meanings.definition: To punch holes in something before it is used.
meanings.sent1: I will prepunch the papers for the binder.
meanings.sent2: She always likes to prepunch the tickets for the event.
meanings.sent3: The teacher decided to prepunch the quiz papers to save time.
meanings.sent4: His quick thinking allowed him to prepunch the cards before the game started.
meanings.sent5: The tailor had to prepunch the fabric before sewing it together.

meanings.definition: A hole that has been punched in advance.
meanings.sent1: The prepunch in the paper made it easier to put in the binder.
meanings.sent2: He noticed a prepunch in the ticket and wondered why it was there.
meanings.sent3: The prepunch in the wall looked like a tiny window to another room.
meanings.sent4: She found a prepunch in the fabric that matched the design perfectly.
meanings.sent5: The prepunch in the leather was a reminder of the craftsmanship involved.
